intro: Tanacetum crassicollum, commonly known as the broad-necked tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are aromatic and slightly hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Tanacetum crassicollum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
